video.title: Keeping Up Appearances
video.synopsis: This series follows the antics of Hyacinth Bucket, whose insistence on proper form at all times is a perpetual thorn in the side of her husband.

episodes.synopsis: Hyacinth Bucket, a snooty social climber, lives a strict life of proper social etiquette. But Hyacinth's self-proclaimed high standing in the community is jeopardized when Daddy is arrested for indecent behavior and held for a psych evaluation.
episodes.title: The Name Is Boquet: B-U-C-K-E-T

episodes.synopsis: Hyacinth's plans to have her church's vicar over for tea are jeopardized when Daisy shows up unannounced and claims a gypsy has kidnapped Hyacinth's father. Matters are complicated further when Rose arrives in a suicidal state.
episodes.title: Welcoming the Dishy Vicar

episodes.synopsis: Hyacinth visits Daisy's home to check up on her father. But he escapes in a superhero costume before Hyacinth can see him. Later, Daisy and Rose follow Hyacinth to a nobleman's estate, prompting Hyacinth to flee before they can embarrass her.
episodes.title: Visiting an Acquaintance's Stately Home

episodes.synopsis: Everyone is in shock when an eccentric woman moves into Daddy's bedroom. The woman claims to be his fiancée and the sisters' stepmother-to-be. It's up to Hyacinth to break up the insane engagement and get rid of the woman for good.
episodes.title: A Fate Worse than Senility

episodes.synopsis: Hyacinth takes charge of a special event at the church and gets drunk on her own power. Across town, Daisy takes a teenage lover in the hopes of making Onslow jealous. The boy toy scheme backfires in ways Daisy could never imagine.
episodes.title: Our Daisy and Her Toy Boy

episodes.synopsis: Hyacinth is embarrassed Daisy's illegitimate granddaughter is about to be christened, because all the busybodies will know there is a Bucket bastard. Hyacinth agrees to take the baby to church, but going to the chapel is easier said than done.
episodes.title: How to Manage a Family Christening

episodes.synopsis: Hyacinth witnesses an unidentified man leave the home of her best friend, Elizabeth, in nothing but a towel. Hyacinth concludes the man must be Elizabeth's secret lover and takes it upon herself to save Elizabeth from scandal and spiritual ruin.
episodes.title: A Strange Man

episodes.synopsis: When a popular socialite turns to Hyacinth for a ride into town, Hyacinth sees it as the perfect opportunity to climb a few rungs up the social ladder. Unfortunately, the plan hits a few bumps when the ladies bump into Rose, Onslow and Daisy.
episodes.title: Driving Mrs. Fortescue

episodes.synopsis: Hyacinth is eager to join the Amateur Operatic Society and learns Elizabeth's boyfriend is a member. To schmooze him, Hyacinth treats Elizabeth and her guy to a fancy dinner. But when Rose and Daisy crash the party, Hyacinth's goose looks cooked.
episodes.title: Candlelight Supper

episodes.synopsis: Hyacinth eagerly accepts an invitation by the major and his wife to spend the weekend at their private golf club, but Hyacinth and Richard haven't any inkling how to golf. And Hyacinth is horrified when the major reveals how he likes to swing.
episodes.title: Golfing with the Major

episodes.synopsis: Determined to find a new wife, Hyacinth's delusional father disappears from Daisy's place. Hyacinth insists they keep their mortifying family matters a secret, especially from Elizabeth and Emmett, and sets out to track him down in secret.
episodes.title: The Googley-Eyes Registrar

episodes.synopsis: Hyacinth couldn't be less excited about an invitation to attend yet another of Onslow's tacky birthday parties. But when Rose's rich new boyfriend plans to pick them up for the festivities, an intrigued Hyacinth hastily changes her tune.
episodes.title: Cocktails with a Greek Shipping Millionaire

episodes.synopsis: Richard is horrified by an early retirement offer when he realizes he'll never have a break from Hyacinth for the rest of his life. Meanwhile, Hyacinth takes another crack at admittance into the Amateur Operatic Society by singing for Emmett.
episodes.title: The Unfortunate Prospect of Early Retirement

episodes.synopsis: Daddy flies the coop from Daisy's and has a ball at the local toy store. When Hyacinth arrives to take him home, the store manager refuses to let either of them leave until she covers the outrageously expensive bill Daddy has racked up on toys.
episodes.title: Playthings for Daddy

episodes.synopsis: Hyacinth can't wait for her fancy new furniture to arrive -- or for her neighbors to see it. But Hyacinth's opportunity to show off her pricey purchases could be overshadowed by Onslow's and Daisy's inept attempt at moving furniture.
episodes.title: Three Piece Suite

episodes.synopsis: To spend more quality time with Daddy, Hyacinth arranges to treat him to a lovely picnic in the countryside. Unfortunately, Daddy puts the brakes on Hyacinth's lovely gesture when he boosts the car and goes for a high-speed joyride around town.
episodes.title: Picnic for Daddy

episodes.synopsis: To impress Richard's boss, Hyacinth arranges for him to dress as Santa and pass out gifts at church. Unfortunately, when a delusional Daddy and an intoxicated Richard show up, making a good impression will take nothing less than a Christmas miracle.
episodes.title: A Very Merry Hyacinth

episodes.synopsis: Hyacinth boards the Queen Elizabeth 2 for a cruise, spots Daisy and Onslow on board and assumes the two troublemakers plan to ruin her trip. With no time to spare, Hyacinth rushes to get them off the boat before anyone is the wiser.
episodes.title: Sea Fever

episodes.synopsis: When Richard is stricken with a bad case of athlete's foot, Hyacinth insists they tell everyone he has a more dignified ailment, such as gout. Over at Daisy's house, Onslow and Daisy are shocked to find a stranger sleeping in Daddy's bed.
episodes.title: Angel Gabriel Blue

episodes.synopsis: Hyacinth produces a play, based on the English Civil War, and casts herself as Queen Henrietta Maria. But when no one else wants to be in it, Hyacinth reluctantly casts Rose, Daisy, Violet, Bruce and Onslow to play the other parts.
episodes.title: Historical Pageant

episodes.synopsis: Richard hates retirement, especially the antique hunts Hyacinth insists they take to the country. Their latest trip proves worse than usual when a stop at Rose's house results in Hyacinth talking her sis through yet another emotional breakdown.
episodes.title: Have a Carnel

episodes.synopsis: After a forced retirement, Richard's worst fears come true when he spends every free moment with Hyacinth. Two Buckets always under the same roof proves too much even for Hyacinth, who stops at nothing to get Richard started on a second career.
episodes.title: How to Retire Early if You're Not Careful

episodes.synopsis: To occupy his time and cheer him up, Hyacinth makes the recently retired Richard take up photography. Unfortunately, he doesn't know how to use a camera or what to shoot. Back at the house, Hyacinth schmoozes Mrs. Nugent for a shot on her committee.
episodes.title: A Portrait of the Artist as a Hen Picked Man

episodes.synopsis: Daddy runs away to enlist in the French Foreign Legion. Fortunately, Hyacinth and Richard manage to track him down. But they quickly come to regret it when Daddy makes a scene at an upscale art exhibition Hyacinth and Richard are invited to attend.
episodes.title: The French Lieutenant's Daughter

episodes.synopsis: Hyacinth is green with envy when neighbor Delia Wheelwright brags about a lavish vacation she has planned to the Caribbean. To top Delia, Hyacinth cons everyone with bogus plans for an ultra-extravagant trip she has no plans to actually take.
episodes.title: How to Go on Holiday Without Really Trying

episodes.synopsis: The Buckets can't wait to embark on a voyage Hyacinth has arranged for herself, Richard and their friends. But when they arrive at the dock to find the "yacht" Hyacinth rented is an eyesore, the Buckets scramble for a way to abandon ship on the trip.
episodes.title: What to Wear When Yachting

episodes.synopsis: Hyacinth and Richard borrow Violet and Bruce's country cottage and use it to ingratiate themselves with their noble neighbors. Much to the Buckets' surprise, the upper-class people prove to be just as nuts as Hyacinth's lower-class family.
episodes.title: Violet's Country Cottage

episodes.synopsis: Hyacinth decides Richard should return to the workforce when she eyes an ad for an executive position at a local company. To impress his would-be boss, Hyacinth insists Richard wow him at golf. Unfortunately, Richard can't play to save his life.
episodes.title: Hyacinth Tees Off!

episodes.synopsis: To help out with a ladies' luncheon, Hyacinth takes it upon herself to deliver the keynote speaker, a Royal Navy Commodore, to the event. Unfortunately, the eccentric Commodore isn't as easy to track down and transport as Hyacinth was led to believe.
episodes.title: The Nautical Speaker

episodes.synopsis: Hyacinth is livid to hear the guests of her neighbors' barbecue included a local star. To top them, Hyacinth plans an ostentatious barbecue of her own, and stops at nothing to book a more prestigious celebrity guest than her neighbors had.
episodes.title: Indoor/Outdoor Luxury Barbeque and Finger Buffet

episodes.synopsis: Hyacinth is determined to have a weekend retreat she can call her own, and forces Richard to scour the country with her in search of a country cottage. But the two soon surmise that a perfect place with an affordable price isn't easy to find.
episodes.title: Rural Retreat

episodes.synopsis: To avoid public humiliation, Hyacinth instructs Richard to disguise himself before he bails out Daddy from the police station. Meanwhile, Hyacinth continues her quest for a weekend home, regardless of Richard's fears that they can't afford it.
episodes.title: Beacon for the Best in Hospitality

episodes.synopsis: Hyacinth becomes co-owner of a spacious mansion in the country and invites several friends out for tea. Unfortunately, the second home only emphasizes just how small and cramped their apartment is in the city.
episodes.title: Please Mind Your Head

episodes.synopsis: When the church experiences electrical problems, Hyacinth promises the vicar that Richard will fix it. Unfortunately, Richard doesn't know anything about electricity. Meanwhile, the flickering lights cause Daddy to have World War II flashbacks.
episodes.title: Let There Be Light

episodes.synopsis: Hyacinth volunteers to take a group of elderly members from the church to the beach for the day. But a seemingly simple drive to the seashore proves to be anything but when Hyacinth has to deal with carsick passengers and a randy old codger.
episodes.title: Seaside Fun

episodes.synopsis: For the first time since Richard's retirement, he and Hyacinth aren't invited to the mayor's annual costume party. But that doesn't stop Hyacinth's plans to attend. Meanwhile, Rose gets engaged to a Polish man whose name she can't pronounce.
episodes.title: The Fancy Dress Ball

episodes.synopsis: On Hyacinth and Richard's wedding anniversary, Hyacinth eagerly awaits his present. Little does she know Richard has forgotten the occasion. Desperate, Richard racks his brain to come up with something before Hyacinth can realize his blunder.
episodes.title: Hyacinth is Alarmed

episodes.synopsis: A simple stroll through the country inspires Hyacinth to throw a picnic on the riverside for Elizabeth, Emmett, the vicar and his wife. But a simple picnic isn't the Bucket way -- Hyacinth insists on fancy alfresco dining, even if it kills her.
episodes.title: Riparian Entertainments

episodes.synopsis: On Richard's birthday, Hyacinth surprises him with a pair of downhill skis. Richard is especially surprised, since neither of them ski. Across town, Rose dates a Christian, who inspires her to seek out answers about the afterlife from the vicar.
episodes.title: Sister, Sister

episodes.synopsis: Hyacinth and Richard attend a sale at the lavish country estate of local aristocrats. Richard frets over what overpriced items Hyacinth is sure to buy. Meanwhile, Hyacinth and the lord of the manor get royally drunk on a variety of expensive wines.
episodes.title: Country Estate Sale

episodes.synopsis: When Emmett makes preparations to do another musical, Hyacinth will stop at nothing for him to cast her as the female lead. Meanwhile, at Daisy's house, Daddy believes he's back in World War II and stands guard outside her door.
episodes.title: General Bucket

episodes.synopsis: Determined to star in Emmett's new musical, Hyacinth invites him to a ritzy barbecue at Violet's house so Hyacinth can sing for him. But Violet and Bruce's constant squabbles make it nearly impossible for Hyacinth to get a note in edgewise.
episodes.title: A Bon Vivant Buffet

episodes.synopsis: Hyacinth is crushed when she loses a crafts fair competition to Lydia, a rival snob. To add insult to injury, Lydia drives a new Rolls Royce. Much to Richard's dismay, Hyacinth decides to save face with the purchase of a pricier Rolls than Lydia's.
episodes.title: A Crafts-Woman Scorned

episodes.synopsis: Hyacinth puts her knowledge of proper etiquette to use when she becomes a professional hostess. To drum up business, Hyacinth places an ad in the newspaper, but the responses she receives aren't even close to what she thought they'd be.
episodes.title: Scintillating Socializing

episodes.synopsis: In this special clip episode, Daisy and Onslow snoop around the Buckets' place and find a hidden diary that contains Hyacinth's most closely guarded memoirs. Unable to resist the urge to respect her privacy, Daisy and Onslow devour every word.
episodes.title: The Memoirs of Hyacinth Bucket
